content: Just turned 22. A new year, a new chapter. The job might be gone, but the drive to innovate in trading hasn't waned. Quantum communication networks are on my radar now.
Set up a meeting with a mentor from my quant finance days. We'll discuss potential paths into blockchain governance. This could be the pivot point I need.
Joined an online group focusing on smart contracts. Learning the ropes and seeing how I can contribute. Maybe a side project here could lead to something bigger.
Had a deep dive into quantum encryption. It's fascinating how it could secure transactions in trading. Might be the edge I need for my proprietary algorithm.
Revisited old trading strategies. Found some inefficiencies to optimize. Time to integrate AI for real-time decision-making.
Connected with a friend from Thailand. He's got insights into the DeFi space. Planning a brainstorming session next week.
Started a small coding project to simulate quantum key distribution. It's complex but could revolutionize secure trading in the future.
Had a coffee chat with a former colleague. Shared my recent job loss. He's interested in a potential collaboration on an open-source blockchain governance project.
Spent the last few days refining my trading algorithm. It's slow progress, but the integration of AI is promising. Still miles to go.
Joined a local blockchain meetup. Met some fascinating people, including someone working on a governance protocol. Might be worth exploring.
Went to a tech conference. Picked up some new ideas on how AI can be applied to trading. The community here is buzzing with potential.
Set up a GitHub repo for my quantum communication project. It's early days, but I'm excited to share progress and get feedback.
Had a breakthrough in my algorithm. The AI-driven code autonomy is starting to show some real-time trading advantages. This could be my ticket back.
A friend from my travels got in touch. He's setting up a startup in NYC and wants my input on their tech strategy. Networking pays off.
The job loss feels like a distant memory now. I'm diving deep into blockchain governance and quantum tech. My career path is clearer, and the support system around me is stronger than ever.
